wikipedia_page.main: Mark Hayler Judge, originally Mark Hayler (26 February 1847 – 25 January 1927) was a British architect and sanitary engineer who was notable for his fight to reform the Metropolitan Board of Works in London in the 1880s.

response: * January 25 – Mark Judge, British architect and engineer (born 1847)
* 25 January – Mark Judge, architect and engineer (born 1847)
* Mark Judge (architect) (1847–1927), British architect and civil engineer
* Mark Judge (writer) (born 1964), American author and journalist
